file_content.text: [There's nothing you can do at this workstation.]
Can you feel it?
The serum begins its work. Bonding to spinal fluid, retracing neural pathways. Painful. Effective.
I'm not worried about the symptoms. I want my mind back.
I can survive a little pain.
You may have saved my life. I won't forget that.
Thank you for your help.
Your memory is the least of my concerns.
If you've made a mistake, I'll make you pay. Even if you are a voice in my head.
This had better work.
I believe you.
The serum's course is unpredictable, and it will take time. But you will be free from the brainwashing
For now, the SIS is waiting. They won't recognize your chance to escape when it comes... but I will.
Look around. Security cameras, gas vents, lockdowns. Your personnel files are here, everything on your brainwashing--but you need to keep this secret.
I need a way to cut the power, black out the monitors temporarily.
So we shut the defenses down.
What do you gain from aiding me?
Why are you helping me?
Only the satisfaction of striking back at Imperial Intelligence.
You're giving advice to the person who killed you.
Why are you helping me?
Yes. If I am the result of brain damage, you must have a warped sense of humor.
Let them see. Maybe they'll even figure out what happened.
I don't care what they know.
They'll stop you before you access your first unauthorized file. Or assume you're doing it for the SIS. Either way your life is over.
If you can find a power generator, you can sabotage security. You'll have a window in which to access the files unseen--but it won't last.
